result.execSummary:
The defendant Lakaylah Alexsandria Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intentionally Point Firearm At Person, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(c).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Submit a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge by 60 DAYS. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Pay all MANDATORY costs, fees and surcharges by 60 DAYS. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lakaylah Alexsandria Johnson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lakaylah Alexsandria Johnson in court, in custody.  Attorney Nicholas John Conrardy in court for Lakaylah Alexsandria Johnson.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing. Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. 

AS TO COUNT 2: 
Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived her rights.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 

AS TO COUNT 1: Pursuant to negotiations and on the motion of the State, Court ordered charge DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    
AS TO COUNT 2:
Defendant ordered to serve 82 DAYS in the House of Correction, credit of 82 days TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.
- Submit a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge by 60 DAYS. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Pay all MANDATORY costs, fees and surcharges by 60 DAYS. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Defendant advised of her right to appeal.

Defendant Lakaylah Alexsandria Johnson not in court, in custody.  Attorney Nicholas John Conrardy in court for Lakaylah Alexsandria Johnson.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel Tyler Tabin in court for the State of Wisconsin. Status conference held. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law. Defense is requesting a plea and sentencing date. Case is adjourned in Branch 13.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 10:30 am.
CORRECTION: Judge Konkol presided over Branch 13 on August 30th, 2022

Defendant Lakaylah Alexsandria Johnson not in court, in custody.  Attorney Nicholas John Conrardy in court for Lakaylah Alexsandria Johnson.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a pre-trial conference. Defendant's appearance waived. Defense does not have discovery or offer.
Case adjourned.
Status conference scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Lakaylah Alexsandria Johnson in court with attorney Theodore D. Kafkas.  Defendant Lakaylah Alexsandria Johnson in custody.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Lakaylah Alexsandria Johnson appeared by video means with Attorney.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 13.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned to Branch 13.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with J.D.B. and her children; LML (JDB's mother); DLN (JDB's neighbor)
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
